tactic: induction E as [| A f IH].
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 3 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall E : Ens, EQ E E

Premises:
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Ens_rec : forall P : Ens -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
ssrbool.predPredType : forall T : Type, ssrbool.predType T
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul...
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
BinNat.N.le_0_l : forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 n
ssrbool.inPhantom : forall p : Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop p
Ring_theory.IDphi : forall R : Type, R -> R
RingMicromega.Op1_rect : forall P : RingMicromega.Op1 -> Type, P RingMicromega.Equal -> P RingMicromega.NonEqual -> P RingMicromega.Strict -> P RingMicromega.NonStrict -> forall o : RingMicromega.Op1, P o
PeanoNat.Nat.le_pred_l : forall n : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.pred n <= n
ssrbool.pred_sort : forall T : Type, ssrbool.predType T -> Type
Ring_polynom.Pc : forall C : Type, C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PEc : forall C : Type, C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.P0 : forall C : Type, C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PEX : forall C : Type, BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
BinInt.Pos2Z.is_nonneg : forall p : BinNums.positive, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinNums.Zpos p)
BinInt.Z.le_succ_diag_r : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n (BinInt.Z.succ n)
BinNat.N.lt_irrefl : forall x : BinNums.N, ~ BinNat.N.lt x x
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
List.rev_involutive : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), List.rev (List.rev l) = l
BinNat.N.induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A n -> A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
List.rev : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
PeanoNat.Nat.compare_refl : forall x : nat, PeanoNat.Nat.compare x x = Eq
BinNat.N.pred_succ : forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.pred (BinNat.N.succ n) = n

```coq
Proof.
  intros E.
  induction E as [| A f IH].
  - simpl. auto.
  - simpl. rewrite <- IH. auto.
Qed.```
